byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Lumberton; Alan Blinder from Tampa, Fla.; and Jonathan M. Katz from Hope Mills, N.C. Campbell Robertson contributed reporting from Charleston, S.C.
byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD, ALAN BLINDER and JONATHAN M. KATZ

abstract: Residents of eastern North Carolina and South Carolina clear debris and struggle to rebound from Hurricane Matthew, which pounded area with high winds and flooding rain; eight deaths are reported, almost half of hurricane's death toll in United States.
lead_paragraph: North Carolina residents had been hopeful that Hurricane Matthew would spare their state. Then the storm struck.
snippet: North Carolina residents had been hopeful that Hurricane Matthew would spare their state. Then the storm struck....

headline.main: North Carolina, Saturated and Surprised, Reels from Hurricane Matthew
headline.print_headline: The Carolinas, Waterlogged  and Surprised, Reel From Storm
